  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59806].
  {panel}

*SUMMARY*
Users without Browse Users permission are able to get autocomplete for assignee field in JIRA issues.

This does *not* affect JIRA issue navigator basic mode for assignee dropdown.

*STEPS TO REPLICATE*
# Create a user without *Browse Users* global permission
# Create an issue
# Try to edit the issue's assignee

*EXPECTED RESULT*
JIRA shouldn't provide users without *Browse Users* permission to get autocomplete feature for usernames - only using complete usernames to assign the issues to others.
fields.summary: Users without Browse Users permission are able to get autocomplete
Add Notification for commenter when issue created in different project.

fields.description:
Hi,
I have a two projects on a Jira Cloud instance, both projects have the same permissions/notifications schemes by 2 projects. I receive notifications from 1 project, but we don't receive from the other one.
The groups and roles are similar on both projects.
I checked the MailQueue and it has issues, but the issue is not clear.
Also, I checked the permissions with the notification helper, and all looks fine.
Do you have a tool or could you help to solved that?
Regards
fields.summary: Not receive issue notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59796].
  {panel}

h3. Summary 

If you haven't yet created a fix version in project admin -> versions, then it isn't possible to edit the "fix version/s" field anywhere.
I.e. you see this (e.g. on edit issue dialog, or view):
!Screen Shot 2016-02-14 at 4.03.17 pm.png|width=500px!

But then once you've created at least one fix version, you see this:
!Screen Shot 2016-02-14 at 4.07.56 pm.png|width=500px!

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new project (without any fix versions added yet)
# Ensure the "fix version/s" field is on all required screens, inside the correct schemes etc (e.g. view and edit screens)
# Ensure the current user has "resolve issue" permission (required to edit the "fix version/s" field)
# Create a new issue and navigate to it
# Open the edit dialog

h3. Expected result:
The "fix version/s" field is editable, with the option to choose "new version"

h3. Actual result:

The field is not editable, with value displayed as *None*

h3. Workaround

Add the new version from Project Administration.

h3. Notes

It *is* possible to create new "fix versions" from the drop-down, so this restriction shouldn't exist.
fields.summary: Can't set fix version if one doesn't exist yet

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59793]. {panel} Pre-formatted is the style type that gives monospacing to text. This is traditionally used when referring to code (variable names, class names, etc...) or short pieces of code. The impetus for this is javadocs which support tags such as: {{variableName}} ( does the same thing) which will give monospace typing to {{variableName}}. Javadocs also support {{
a bunch of code here
}} which is handy for formatting a lot of code. JIRA handles the {{
}} situation quite well with the "code" tags. It makes an attempt to handle in-line monospace typing with "Preformatted". This works well most of the time, but it is completely broken when trying to use with JSON code snippets.

Example:
The HTTP response came back as {{{"result" : "success"}}} but after performing step 3...

^^^ This all should have been one line, but you will notice that my attempt to use the Preformatted style on {"result" : "success"} broke. In fact, I just noticed that even this should have been one line, but the curly braces for some reason cause a new line to get inserted (twice).

You might suggest that we use the "code" tags as a work around. But this simply not acceptable. As JavaDocs and other formatting tools support inline monospacing on code snippets for readability purposes, so should JIRA. In fact, Preformatting works well with code snippets for nearly any language EXCEPT JSON.

Thus this is a bug.
fields.summary: Preformatted style with JSON text is broken

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
I did [change the format|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/changing-the-due-date-input-format-192536.html] for both Date and Date Time picker but the look and feel is not showing the correct format. Lets say I used the format for DateTime and Date picker as
- jira.date.picker.java.format=yyyy-MM-dd
- jira.date.picker.javascript.format=%Y-%m-%d
- jira.date.time.picker.java.format=yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm
- jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format=%Y-%m-%d %H:%M 

Set the date as 
Date=02/09/1900
DateTIme=1900-02-02 18:02
- When viewing it via browsing it image A ( Format is showing differently in UI )
- When you try to edit it image B & C ( These looks fine )
- When you export it via excel image D ( DatePicker format/data is wrong ). 
Verified in backend and dates are correct.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to JIRA as SYS Admin
# [Change Date and Date time format||https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/changing-the-due-date-input-format-192536.html] using above format.

h3. Expected Results
Format in UI and extracting data for DatePicker should be same data and format.

h3. Actual Results
Check Image A and Image D column DatePicker field.
 

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Date/DateTime Picker log format different in UI and Date exported to excel shows different date
Be able to resize columns in JIRA's project viewer

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59788].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
Currently, when a project has been archived, this archive state is achieved by removing all permissions other than the browse project permission.

However, as voting and watching issues do not have any permissions associated with them at project level, users are able to still vote and watch archived issues.

*Feature*
Can a feature be added that prevents modifying an archived issue entirely or can project level permissions be added for the vote and watch issue features?
fields.summary: Restrict ability to Vote and Watch Archived Projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59781].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The default permission scheme cannot be edited. Editing causes a blank page with NPE.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure the permission scheme to include a single user.
# Remove the user from user management
# Load Permission Scheme
# Edit the system Default Permission Scheme

h3. Expected Results
Default Permission Scheme is loaded
h3. Actual Results
A blank Page is shown
JIRA logs displays below error
{noformat}
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018914500 2016-02-12 09:05:51,015 http-nio-2990-exec-3 ERROR sysadmin 545x434x1 13irxx6 103.233.242.8,104.192.140.49,127.0.0.1 /rest/internal/2/managedpermissionscheme/11900 [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018916500 java.lang.NullPointerException
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018916500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.updateSchemeToReturnUsername(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:436)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018917500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.access$2200(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:58)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018951500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService$13.apply(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:331)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018951500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService$13.apply(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:327)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018952500 	at com.atlassian.fugue.Option$Some.fold(Option.java:421)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018952500 	at com.atlassian.fugue.Option.flatMap(Option.java:287)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018956500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.getScheme(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:327)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018957500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.getPermissionScheme(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:105)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018962500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.getManagedPermissionScheme(ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.java:92)
2016-02-12 09:05:51.018962500 	... 3 filtered
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* Cloning the default permission scheme causes the same problem.
* Using the delete user API will delete these records.
* It appears that this can be caused by deleting users from a user directory (by removing that directory), or through other means.

h3.Workaround
For Cloud, please contact Support. For server:

Can fix this with:
# Execute the below SQL to identify problematic records:
{code:SQL}
select * from schemepermissions where perm_type = 'user' and (perm_parameter in (select user_key from app_user where lower_user_name not in (select lower_user_name from cwd_user)) or perm_parameter not in (select user_key from app_user));
{code}
# Stop JIRA.
# Backup the JIRA database using the native DB tools.
# Remove the problematic records.
# Start JIRA.
# Test by editing the scheme.

If there's any issues with the update, roll-back to the backup. For additional help please raise a support case at [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com].
fields.summary: Permission Scheme cannot be edited when it includes a single user

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59758].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

 A  customer (Jira Service Desk) can be added as a watcher to a jira-software issue.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Service Desk Project and JIRA Software Project.
# Invite or Create a Service Desk Customer  i.e "usera" (user without any permissions or application access) to JSD project. 
# Login as a user with the manage watchers permission i.e. "userb" on a JIRA software project. 
# Create JIRA Service Desk issue "TESTA" and JIRA Software issue "TESTB".
# Add customer "usera" as a watcher to the JIRA Service Desk issue i.e "TESTA".
# Add customer "usera" as a watcher to JIRA Software issue i.e. TESTB.

h3. Expected Results
*Test A.)* Adding a customer "usera "as watcher to a Jira Service Desk issue "TESTA" would not be allowed as it only applies to jira-users with the correct permission not customers. The customer should be added as a [Request Participant| https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/adding-request-participants-732528959.html]  to the JIRA Service Desk issue instead. 
*Test B)* Adding a JIRA Service Desk customer "usera" as watcher with (no application access or Jira permissions to the JIRA software project/issue) should not be allowed. 

h3. Actual Results

*Test A.)*  Adding  customer "usera" as a watcher to JSD issue "TESTA") results in a permissions issue "The user "usera" does not have permission to view this issue. This user will not be added to the watch list."  
*Test B.)* Customer is added as a watcher to the jira-software issue (with no jira-software or permission access to the project/issue) and can receive issue updates.

h3. Notes
I was able to reproduce this in my test instance JIRA v7.1.0-OD-06-005 with JSD Version: 3.2.0-OD-01-002-D20160204T062648  and JIRA Server 7.0.10 and JSD  v3.0.10.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk customers can be added as watchers to JIRA Software and JIRA Core issues.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
In other browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, IE11, IE10), you can use the 'tab' key to navigate through the header bar, down the sidebars, and into the pages. However, in Safari 'tab' takes you to the search field, and maybe a few page elements, but does not go along the JIRA header or sidebars.

h3. Environment
* Browser: Safari 8.0.2
* OS: Mac OS X 10.10.1
* Java: 1.8.0_40

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open JIRA in Safari
# Navigate with tab key on any page (first noticed in the project administration section)

h3. Expected Results
Navigating with the tab key should cycle through all the selectable elements on the page.

h3. Actual Results
The selection moves from the the browser search bar, along browser bookmarks, into the JIRA search bar, maybe onto some other page elements. However, it does not select items across the JIRA header or sidebar elements (both project central sidebar and project administration sidebar).

h3.Workaround
Navigation and selection with the mouse is not affected and can be used as normal. Could use another browser.
fields.summary: Tab keyboard navigation doesn't work in Safari

h3. Problem Definition

Original: The option paste screen shots from "More" is available in certain jira projects while not in others.  I did look at JRA-47028, but that still does not answer why it is available in some and not others.  Thanks

Having a JIRA ticket opened as a result of search per figure  (issue navigator split view): 
 !Attach Screenshot yes.jpg|thumbnail!  
the option Attach Screenshot is available when click More.

But opening same issue in detailed view (standalone view issue page) per this figure: 
 !Attach Screenshot No.jpg|thumbnail! 
The option Attach Screenshot is not available when click More.

h3. Steps To Reproduce

# Open a JIRA ticket in detailed view, per screenshot attached above.
# Click More button

h3. Expected Behavior

The user should not be able to see the Attach Screenshot option under Attach Files

h3. Actual Behavior

The attach screenshot is available when searching for the issue (ServiceDesk Queue or any other search result, issue navigator split view).
fields.summary: The "Attach Screenshot" menu item is still available depending how you query the JIRA ticket

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59736].
  {panel}


h3. Problem Definition

----

When an issue doesn't meet the criteria of a workflow validator the error messages aren't intuitive to resolving the validation issue. 

i.e.

- Have a workflow validator that checks that the parent status is in a particular status for a subtask on a workflow. 

!wkfw.png|thumbnail!

If you try to create the subtask you get an error that it has unsupported content in an issue field and to contact your admin to check the log file for specific info. 

Error creating issue:
!error.png|thumbnail!

We see the exact error in the logs:

com.atlassian.jira.exception.CreateException: Transition is not authorized because current Issue's parent Issue should be in one of the following statuses: [To Do, Selected for Development, Reopened, Scheduled for development, In Progress, Backlog]

----

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Provide more specific information relative to the validation error via the UI instead of the logs similar to a workflow helper such as [where is my field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-admin-helper-376834956.html#JIRAAdminHelper-FieldHelper] available from the issue view to identify the cause. 

----
h3. Workaround 

1.) Reproduce the issue.
2.) Tail the logs at the time or check the general time frame the issue occurred in the logs. 
----
fields.summary: Improve UI error messages related to workflow validators.

  {panel}

When in Adobe Fireworks (or similar software), if you create a text box and copy the selected text then paste into JIRA, an image is uploaded rather than text. It would be nice if there was a setting in JIRA that specified preference for copied data to come in as text.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open Adobe Fireworks (or similar software)
2. Select text
3. Copy selection to clipboard
4. Switch to Jira
5. Edit an existing ticket
6. Place focus in ticket description
7. Hit ctrl-v

Expected results:
Text on clipboard is pasted into description

Actual results:
Screenshot attachment dialog pops up with bitmap of text

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59713].
  {panel}

The documentation for JIRA Software 7.0's Project Import tool, at [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/restoring-a-project-from-backup-749383456.html], lacks clarity when it comes to importing Agile-style JIRA projects.  Please revise the documentaiton to address the following four issues, numbered A, B, C & D:

A) When importing JIRA Agile projects from one JIRA Software 7.0 system to another, the user is in a Catch-22 situation regarding workflows.  The Project Import documentation states:

{color:#14892c}"If you wish to retain a customized workflow from your backup, you will need to create a new workflow in your target JIRA instance and manually edit the new workflow (e.g. create steps and transitions) to reflect your old workflow "
. . .
"Do not use the JIRA functionality for exporting and importing workflow XML definitions, to copy your backup workflow to your target JIRA instance."
{color}

However, when it comes to Aglie projects, the workflow itself contains comments which contradict the above documentation:

{color:#654982}"This workflow is managed internally by JIRA Agile. Do not manually modify this workflow"{color}

Please provide clarification what to do specifically regarding workflows when importing Agile-style projects:

1) Should the workflow be recreated manually?
2) Should the workflow be exported as XML, then imported on the target system and manually revised?
3) Or is it best to use the workflow that is created when the empty project is first created on the target system?

B) When creating the new empty projects on the target system, is it OK to create a non-Agile project, then later associate the project with an Agile workflow?  Or must the new empty projects be created as Agile projects from the start (via an Agile-enabled project template)?

C) I often assign the same workflow to multiple non-Aglie projects.  Is it possible for Agile projects to have shared workflows?  Or must each Agile project have a distinct workflow?

D) Please provide some sample SQL queries that could be used to re-establish Boards and other Agile data that the JIRA Software 7.0 Import Tool currently skips.  So far, the best procedure I have found is at [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/18448856/how-to-import-jira-agile-sprint-data-project-by-project], but there is no way for me to know whether these steps are correct and complete.
fields.summary: Clarify documentation for using Project Import tool

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59710].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Currently importing project with Subtask from Trello using JIRA's External Import will result in following error:

{quote}Could not import checklists: there is no SubTask issue type in the target JIRA project.{quote}

This happens because JIRA's subtask is named *Sub-Tasks*.

h3. Environment
6.4.12 -> JIRA 7.0.10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open External System Import in JIRA
# Import Trello Project which contains subtask

h3. Expected Results
All the issues including subtask imported correctly with their respective issue type.

h3. Actual Results
User is prompted with the following error:

{quote}Could not import checklists: there is no SubTask issue type in the target JIRA project.{quote}

h3.Workaround
Create task type Sub-Task with name "SubTask" for the Project imported from Trello
fields.summary: Trello Sub-Task Issue Type

h3. Problem Definition
-  Client encountered production outage while users are running JQL query and JIRA Admin rename one of the default out of the box statuses. Client also mentioned that the jira default workflow is restricted why not restrict the ability to rename the statuses within it.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59702].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Many API endpoints use the startat parameter to determine the index starting point, and then maxresults parameter to determine how many results will be returned. The groups endpoint instead users to [start:end] endpoint to determine which results will be returned.

For example, for users 50-100 it is:

* https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=jira-users&expand=users[50:100]

Whereas you would expect

* https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=jira-users&expand=users&startAt=50&maxResults=100


The inconsistent user experience makes it difficult to know which method to use.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make all rest endpoints consistent in the way they handle startat and maxresults.

h3. Workaround

The [JIRA REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/] typically specifies how it should be used, refer to the docs if you're not sure which to use.
fields.summary: JIRA API request for groups doesn't recognise startat or maxresult parameter

{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
We’ve now addressed this in the [new issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORECLOUD/The+new+Jira+issue+view]!
- When the date of the action is <= 7 days ago, you’ll be able to switch between relative and absolute formats by clicking on the timestamp.
- When the date of the action is > 7 days ago, it will always show the timestamp in absolute format, as per our design guidelines.

If you don’t have the new issue view yet, you can try it out by clicking on your avatar > Personal settings then turning on New Jira issue view under Labs. For more info, check out [The new Jira issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORECLOUD/The+new+Jira+issue+view].
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59696].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There are several places where autocompletion is not as smart as it should be:
- When typing an @-mention to reference a person in an issue, autocomplete should prioritize people who are already watching/associated with the issue. For example, if I type "@john", I shouldn't have to search through all the Johns in Yahoo if I intend to reply to one who already commented on the same issue.
- When typing an epic name (e.g. when adding an epic to an issue), autocomplete should prioritize epics associated with the board I'm using. It's confusing to start typing an epic name and be presented with all the epics in the entire Jira system.



h3. Suggested Solution
 Nothing at the moment
fields.summary: Autocomplete suggestions
Pasting data that can be interpreted as text or image data prefers screenshot attachment

  {panel}

h3. Repro
# Create a saved filter
# Share the filter with everyone
# Add a Filter Results gadget to a JIRA dashboard
# In the Saved Filter field, start typing your filter name from step 1

h3. Actual Results
I am seeing a very limited set of saved filters in the autocomplete and there is no option to see more matching results. Entering the exact name of my filter also does not work. Entering the filter ID# also does not work.
Video here: http://screencast.com/t/cp0T32FiNrq

h3. Expected
Should see my filter when I type its name so I can select it. Or should get an "Advanced search" option like in the Issue Statistics gadget.
fields.summary: Filter Results gadget does not let me choose my saved filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59689].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Before the release of JIRA 7, users without the JIRA *Users Global Permission* were not able to log in to JIRA, but if they belonged to a group that had Create Issue permission for a project, they could create issues via email if a JIRA email handler was set up, as documented here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email

In JIRA 7, a user must have access to at least one JIRA application (JIRA Software, JIRA Service Desk, or JIRA Core) in order to create issues, regardless of how the issue is created. This means that any user that is not able to log in to JIRA and create an issue via the Create Issue dialog will not be able to create issues via a JIRA email handler. This changes caused the existing JIRA Mail Handlers to throw messages when performing a test run.

!Selection_076.png|thumbnail!


h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the users without application access to create issue via email if they belong to a group that has permission to create issue in JIRA.


h3. Workaround 
Set up anonymous issue creation as [documented here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Allowing+anonymous+access+to+your+project] and change the email addresses of users being deleted or disabled so they are not matched by the mail handler: [JRA-33116|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-33116]

Another workaround would be to have a "Forward Email" address in the mail handler so you are notified on failing emails and users can be manually enabled or created.
fields.summary: JIRA users need application access to create issue via email

fields.description:
Hi 

Need quick help in fixing this issue as this is a critical production related concern. 
We face an Error in Deleting an Issue & Uploading an Attachment 

The Error Log is below : 

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: io/atlassian/blobstore/plugin/analytics/Event$Type 
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: io/atlassian/blobstore/plugin/analytics/Event$Type 
at io.atlassian.blobstore.plugin.analytics.EventPublishingBlobStoreService.delete(EventPublishingBlobStoreService.java:173) [?:?]

at com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.store.BlobStoreAttachmentStore.deleteBlob(BlobStoreAttachmentStore.java:209) [BlobStoreAttachmentStore.class:?]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59683].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Permission schemes that have non-existent users explicitly added to a permission type cannot be edited (the header and sidebar load, but where the permissions should be listed is blank).

There's two situations where this can occur:

1) A user exists in a user directory, is granted explicit permission in a permission scheme, and the user directory that the user is in is subsequently disabled.

2) Back in the days of JIRA Studio and Enterprise Hosted instances, there were two special users with the usernames "enterprise-hosted-support" or "contegix" (or both) that were the equivalent of the current "sysadmin" user. There's several places in JIRA's codebase that check for this username and exclude it from various operations.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Start a local JIRA, connect it to an external user directory of some sort.
# Add a user that exists only in that directory (and not the internal JIRA directory) to a permission scheme.
# Import that JIRA data into a Cloud instance.
# Try to edit the permission scheme.

h3. Expected results
The permission scheme page loads.

h3. Actual results
Where the permissions _should_ be is blank, and this stack trace is thrown in the logs:

{code:none}
2016-02-03 14:23:31,764 http-nio-2990-exec-53 ERROR sysadmin 863x4563x1 15k3ark 103.233.242.8,104.192.140.242,127.0.0.1 /rest/internal/2/managedpermissionscheme/0 [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.updateSchemeToReturnUsername(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:436)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.access$2200(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService$13.apply(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:331)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService$13.apply(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:327)
	at com.atlassian.fugue.Option$Some.fold(Option.java:421)
	at com.atlassian.fugue.Option.flatMap(Option.java:287)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.getScheme(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:327)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.getPermissionScheme(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.getManagedPermissionScheme(ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.java:92)
	... 3 filtered
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.java:26)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy131.getManagedPermissionScheme(Unknown Source)
	... 3 filtered
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
[...]
{code}

h3. Workarounds
h4. Workaround 1
For Cloud specifically, the following SQL will find the individual user and which permission scheme they're part of:

{code:sql}
SELECT  distinct(p.name),
        s.perm_type,
        s.perm_parameter
FROM    permissionscheme p,
        schemepermissions s
WHERE   p.id = s.scheme AND
        s.perm_parameter NOT IN (
            SELECT  user_name
            FROM    cwd_user
            WHERE   directory_id = (
                SELECT  id
                FROM    cwd_directory
                WHERE   directory_name = 'Remote Crowd Directory'
            )
        ) AND
        s.perm_type = 'user'
ORDER BY p.name asc;
{code}

To remove all of the missing users from the permission schemes:

{code:sql}
DELETE FROM schemepermissions
WHERE perm_type = 'user' AND
perm_parameter NOT IN (
    SELECT  user_name
    FROM    cwd_user
    WHERE   directory_id = (
        SELECT  id
        FROM    cwd_directory
        WHERE   directory_name = 'Remote Crowd Directory'
    )
);
{code}

h4. Workaround 2
# Create a user with the same username for any broken reference
# Change the Permission Scheme to remove the reference
# Remove the users
fields.summary: Permission schemes with non-existent users that have been explicitly granted a permission cannot be edited

  {panel}

JIRA needs public rest API's that can answer the following questions:

* Is this user a member of this project role?
* Does this user have this permission? (Potentially covered by [this|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/user-findUsersWithAllPermissions])
* In what projects does is the user a member of the given project role?

In general, for Atlassian Connect add-ons, you need to be able to tell what permissions you have to various projects.

See: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/35764459/working-with-project-roles-effectively for an example of some of the uses cases required.
fields.summary: Make public rest API's to ask permission questions of JIRA
Command + Return should submit the current form

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59642].
  {panel}

We need the ability to log work on closed issues without allowing any other updates to the issue.   Today with the  _jira.issue.editable = false_ we can log comments but we can't add work logs. 

Since this behaviour might not be desirable by everyone I suggest a new Workflow Step Property like  

_jira.issue.logwork = true/false_

and thus people desiring this functionality could set up their Closed status as

_jira.issue.editable false_
_jira.issue.logwork true_

in the past there have been cumbersome workarounds with hidden workflow steps but the "hide transition" now hides it from everything but workflow triggers.  A solution like this would benefit everyone who needs to log time on a closed issue without actually re-opening it.
fields.summary: ability to log work on Closed issues when jira.issue.editable = false

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59641].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When we do create new custom fields we try to give them generic names which are not project specific and can be ‘re-used’ by other projects. A custom description is then used at a project level to make the field more meaningful on the screen. However there is a limit as to how generic a field name can be before it becomes meaningless. In the situation we currently have we need 4 fields each of which can have a yes / no response. The information being captured for this project is specific to one project only so if the ‘full’ field name is used it is unlikely it will ever be re-used by a subsequent project. However if we just called the new fields very generic names (eg ‘Check Box 1’) and had a custom context field description the field could be re-used. The problem comes when the issue is ‘viewed’ rather than created / edited. In create or edit the field descriptions are displayed but in ‘view’ just the field name is shown.  This means that if we had 4 new ‘check box’ fields it would not be clear to someone when ‘viewing’ the issue as to which field was which and what it related to.

h3. Suggested Solution

It should show custom field description when 'viewing' the issue.
 
h3. Workaround 
* Click Create/Edit issue to see the field description
fields.summary: Show custom field description on the issue view screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59638].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently when user tries to do Project Import from JIRA Cloud to latest version of JIRA Server, they will be prompted with the error message:
(x) *This data appears to be from an older version of JIRA. Please upgrade the data and try again. The current version of JIRA is at build number '70119', but the supplied backup file was for build number '71001'.*

The error message is misleading because JIRA Cloud's build number is always newer version that JIRA Server's build number. 

h3. Environment
JIRA Server Project Import

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Setting -> System -> Administrator -> System -> Restore System 
# Restore the Cloud backup in latest JIRA version and see the error in the UI.

h3. Expected Results
*The data appears to be from a newer version JIRA* 

h3. Actual Results
*The data appears to be from a older version JIRA* 

h3. Notes
Full JIRA Import with that same JIRA Cloud Export works as expected.

h3. Workaround
[Restoring a project from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/restoring-a-project-from-backup-185729444.html#RestoringaProjectfromBackup-RestoringaprojectfromJIRACloudtoJIRAServer]
fields.summary: Wrong import error message, due to Build Number
Import error message is not meaningful

Currently, the statuses is shown on the issue navigator regardless of projects. And since the introduction of JIRA 7, JIRA Core, JIRA Software and JIRA Service Desk are known as different application.

It will be nice to have if a JIRA Software user able to see the fields and statuses only applicable to JIRA Software. Same goes to JIRA Core and JIRA Service Desk.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59629].
  {panel}

*Suggestion Summary*

When a user accesses the JIRA database schema documentation, they are presented with 2 schemas, one for JIRA 5.1.2 and another for JIRA 6.1.

Should the customer however happen to be using a newer version of JIRA, he or she would not be able to tell what changes have been to the Schema since then.Current version of JIRA is JIRA 7.0.10, however there are no documentations for this nor earlier versions that came after 6.1.

Finding out changes would require users to manually go through the database and stumble on changes accidentally when querying for tables or going through the *Preparing for JIRA <version>*  documentation which mentions changes even though at times it does not say it's a database change.

Can this be updated with the appropriate diagram to emphasize what the schema now looks like?

Thanks.

Ismael
fields.summary: Update JIRA Database Schema Documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA counts all users to the license count. However, Admins may have non-human users that are only for technical purposes, like synchronizing JIRA, after logging into JIRA, with an external system. This could be a huge factor in Service Desk, where the lowest license tier has 3 agents and therefore the admin might not have the luxury to have a non-human task like synchronization get counted as a single user. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a way to handle non-human users, so that they do not get counted towards the license.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want JIRA to be able to handle not real (human) users so that don't get counted to the license

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59622].
  {panel}

This is a feature request (though probably in the wrong spot). 

One of our users is having her name autocompleted in Safari. This can be disabled on a per-user level but not (easily) for every user in the site. 

This feature I believe would be useful in the system settings. 

This is the guide to set this flag per user: https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf54/confluence-user-s-guide/creating-content/using-the-editor/using-autocomplete#UsingAutocomplete-Enablinganddisablingautocomplete
fields.summary: Disable Autocomplete for Site
